intro: Ptilotus laxus, commonly known as the "bush morning glory," is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its prostrate or ascending growth habit. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red, often appearing in clusters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Ptilotus laxus is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy soils across the arid and semi-arid regions of Australia.
